questions.question: What is the chemical symbol for gold?
questions.explanation: Gold's chemical symbol is Au, derived from its Latin name 'aurum'

questions.question: What planet is known as the Red Planet?
questions.explanation: Mars appears red due to iron oxide (rust) on its surface

questions.question: In what year did World War II end?
questions.explanation: World War II ended in 1945 with the surrender of Japan in September

questions.question: Who was the first President of the United States?
questions.explanation: George Washington served as the first President from 1789-1797

questions.question: What is the capital of France?
questions.explanation: Paris is the capital and largest city of France

questions.question: Which is the smallest country in the world?
questions.explanation: Vatican City is the smallest country with an area of about 0.44 square kilometers

questions.question: Who wrote 'Pride and Prejudice'?
questions.explanation: Jane Austen wrote this classic novel, published in 1813

questions.question: What is the real name of the author who writes under the pen name 'Stephen King'?
questions.explanation: Stephen King's full name is Steven Edwin King

questions.question: How many players are on a basketball team on the court?
questions.explanation: Each basketball team has 5 players on the court at a time

questions.question: In which sport would you see a 'Home Run'?
questions.explanation: A home run is a baseball term for when a batter hits the ball and completes all bases

questions.question: In which year was the first 'Titanic' movie released?
questions.explanation: James Cameron's 'Titanic' was released in December 1997

questions.question: How many Academy Awards did 'Titanic' win?
questions.explanation: 'Titanic' won 11 Academy Awards, tying with 'Ben-Hur' and 'West Side Story'

questions.question: How many strings does a standard violin have?
questions.explanation: A violin has 4 strings: G, D, A, and E

questions.question: Which artist released the album '21' that became the best-selling album of the 2010s?
questions.explanation: Adele's album '21' was the best-selling album of the 2010s decade

questions.question: How many chambers does a human heart have?
questions.explanation: The human heart has 4 chambers: two atria and two ventricles

questions.question: What is the largest organ in the human body?
questions.explanation: The skin is the largest organ, covering about 2 square meters in adults

questions.question: What does 'USB' stand for?
questions.explanation: USB stands for Universal Serial Bus, a standard for connecting peripherals

questions.question: In what year was the World Wide Web invented?
questions.explanation: Tim Berners-Lee invented the World Wide Web in 1989

questions.question: What is the main ingredient in guacamole?
questions.explanation: Avocado is the primary ingredient in guacamole

questions.question: What country is the origin of sushi?
questions.explanation: Sushi originated in Japan and is a traditional Japanese cuisine

questions.question: What is the fastest land animal?
questions.explanation: The cheetah can reach speeds of up to 70 mph (112 km/h)

questions.question: How many legs does an octopus have?
questions.explanation: An octopus has 8 legs (called arms), hence the name 'octo' meaning eight

questions.question: What is the largest ocean on Earth?
questions.explanation: The Pacific Ocean is the largest, covering about 46% of the world's ocean surface

questions.question: How many continents are there?
questions.explanation: There are 7 continents: Africa, Antarctica, Asia, Europe, North America, Oceania, and South America

questions.question: Who painted the Mona Lisa?
questions.explanation: Leonardo da Vinci painted the Mona Lisa in the early 1500s

questions.question: In what year did Vincent van Gogh cut off his ear?
questions.explanation: Van Gogh cut off his ear in December 1888 during a mental health episode

questions.question: Which country has the largest economy in the world?
questions.explanation: The United States has the largest nominal GDP in the world

questions.question: What does 'GDP' stand for?
questions.explanation: GDP stands for Gross Domestic Product, a measure of economic output

questions.question: What vitamin is produced when skin is exposed to sunlight?
questions.explanation: Vitamin D is synthesized in the skin when exposed to UV rays from sunlight

questions.question: What is the most common blood type?
questions.explanation: O+ (O positive) is the most common blood type, found in about 37% of the population
